candidates.title: Listen on either stack for websocket connections
candidates.body:
### Summary

Apparently dual-stack for `localhost` just isn't a thing. The translation doesn't happen within machines, it is supposed to happen between machines so that machines running different IP versions can communicate. If you want to listen on either interface on localhost then you have to do that yourself.

### TODO:
- [ ] CHANGELOGs updated with appropriate info

candidates.title: Dependency updates
candidates.body:
### Summary

I've picked off all the dependency updates that are reasonably straight forward to do.

Anything that required significant code changes, or any code changes in code that we aren't actively using, I have left alone for now and I will open an issue to track those. E.g. tungstenite.

I removed `once_cell` in a few places that we no longer need it.

I used [`cargo machete`](https://github.com/bnjbvr/cargo-machete) to find some unused dependencies. There are probably more because the tool doesn't do that well with optional dependencies. Anything we can get rid of is code we don't have to keep building every time we run the tests though :)

### TODO:
- [ ] CHANGELOGs updated with appropriate info

candidates.body:
### Summary

The warning we've been getting for an age about 'uses features that are incompatible with future Rust releases' for `nom` can finally go. There's a version of `cron` that uses the latest `nom` :)
